description: From the name of a class of people in Jonathan Swift's 1726 satirical novel Gulliver's Travels, who are immortal but remain susceptible to aging and disease.

adjectives.description: struldbruggian (comparative more struldbruggian, superlative most struldbruggian)

entries.meaning: Having or relating to an unsatisfactory form of immortality accompanied by aging and disease.
examples: Tithonus, reaching for immortality, achieves only a struldbruggian kind of existence; and Ulysses in his infinite search for knowledge sets out with his mariners on that final voyage that leads them only deathward.
